intro: Castilleja nervata, commonly known as the slender stickler, is a hemiparasitic plant found in the western United States. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has a slender, branched stem and small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It typically grows in open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges, often forming dense colonies. Castilleja nervata relies on other plants for some of its nutrients, making it an important component of its ecological community.
